General Equipment[edit | edit source]

While most equipment varies for the different styles of combat, some pieces of equipment are universal, and have no real variety between the different skills. This is usually because of the limitations of the League, where "better" items for specific combat styles are unavailable.

Rings[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Ring of recoil • Returns a small amount of damage done to the player back to the monster attacking them.
• Sapphire rings can be crafted at level 20 Crafting. A ring mould can be found using the tool store 4 in a player owned house, requiring 44 construction.
Brimstone ring • The only stat-boosting ring available, it gives best-in-slot offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Pieces of the Brimstone ring are obtained as rare drops from hydras or the Alchemical Hydra, which require level 95 Slayer to kill.

Capes[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Black cape • Has very minor defensive bonuses.
• Dropped by the Highwayman west of the Port Piscarilius docks.
Vestment cloak • Along with slightly better defensive bonuses, gives a +1 Magic boost.
• Only obtainable as a reward from medium clue caskets.
Obsidian cape (r) • Has significant defensive bonuses, equivalent to those of a skillcape.
• Only obtainable as a reward from master clue caskets.
Cape of skulls • Has significant defensive bonuses, equivalent to those of a skillcape.
• Only obtainable as a reward from easy clue caskets
Construct. cape(t) • Has the same significant defensive bonuses of the obsidian cape, with an additional +4 Prayer bonus.
• Obtainable from the Estate Agent after reaching level 99 Construction, with at least one other skill also at level 99.
3rd age cloak • Has the same significant defensive bonuses of the obsidian cape, with an additional +5 Prayer bonus.
• Only obtainable as an extremely rare reward from Treasure Trails.

Prayer Equipment[edit | edit source]

Some gear is notable for its Prayer bonus, rather than any offensive or defensive stats it may give.

Item Notes
Holy sandals • Gives a +3 Prayer bonus.
• Only obtainable as a rare reward from medium clue caskets.
Holy wraps • Gives a +3 Prayer bonus.
• Only obtainable as a very rare reward from elite clue caskets.
Kharedst's memoirs • Besides being useful for its teleports, also gives a +1 Prayer bonus.
• Obtained as a reward from completing the Client of Kourend quest.
Rada's blessing 2 • As of the 2nd blessing it will give a +1 Prayer bonus. The 4th blessing will provide +2 Prayer bonus.
• Obtained as a reward from completing the Kourend & Kebos diary.
Shade robe top • Gives a +5 Prayer bonus.
• Dropped by shades at a 1/4 rate.
Shade robe • Gives a +4 Prayer bonus.
• Dropped by shades at a 1/4 rate.
Vestment robes • Pieces of the vestment robes sets give the highest available Prayer bonuses for their respective item slots.
• Only obtainable as rewards from completing easy, medium, and hard clue caskets.

Melee Equipment[edit | edit source]

Weaponry[edit | edit source]

At low levels, the easiest source of weaponry will be Briget's Weapons, a shop available with at least 20% Shayzien favour. She sells scimitars up to the mithril scimitar, and swords up to the adamant sword, which is the best weapon she offers. Beyond her offerings, any better weaponry must be obtained either through Smithing or from a monster drop. A list of recommended weapons and how to obtain them is as follows:

Item Notes
Rune scimitar • Dropped by Gangsters, Gang bosses, Fire giants, Zombies, Skeletons, Kourend head guards.
Mystic air staff • Dropped by Dust devils at a 1/128 rate. Dust devils require 65 Slayer to kill. Despite being a magic staff it has decent crush melee stats, useful for killing Sarachnis.
Dragon hasta • Obtained from the brimstone chest at a 1/200 rate.
Dragon sword • Dropped by Wyrms at a 1/10,000 rate, increased to 1/2,000 rate while on a Slayer task. Wyrms require level 62 Slayer to kill.
Dragon warhammer • Extemely useful for its unique Defence-lowering Special attack.
• Dropped by Lizardman shamans at a 1/5000 rate.
Sarachnis cudgel • Dropped by Sarachnis at a 1/384 rate.
Abyssal dagger • Dropped by Abyssal demons at a 1/32,768 rate, which require level 85 Slayer to kill.
Abyssal whip • Dropped by Abyssal demons at a 1/512 rate, which require level 85 Slayer to kill.
Dragon hunter lance • Uniquely powerful against dragons and other draconic creatures.
• Dropped by the Alchemical Hydra at a 1/1,001 rate, which requires level 95 Slayer and a Hydra slayer task to kill.
Elder maul • Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Armour[edit | edit source]

Within the limitations of the Twisted League, most of the usual strength-boosting armours are unavailable. This means that in most cases, metal armour sets will be the best equipment for Melee combat. With at least 20% Shayzien favour, low-level armours can be sourced from Briget's Armour. No shops sell any armours better than Steel, so any stronger equipment must be obtained either through Smithing or from a monster drop. A list of armour pieces and monsters that drop them is as follows:

Head[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Black med helm • Dropped by Gangsters, Gang boss, Mutated Bloodvelds, and Insatiable mutated Bloodvelds.
Black full helm • Obtained in Reward casket (easy).
Mithril full helm • Dropped by Mutated Bloodvelds, Brutal blue dragons.
Adamant med helm • Dropped by Temple Spiders.
Adamant full helm • Dropped by Brutal red dragons, medium clue caskets.
Rune med helm • Dropped by Mutated Bloodvelds, Lizardman shamans, Wyrms, Greater Nechryaels, Sarachnis, Twisted Banshees, Abyssal demons, Lesser demons, Black demons, Abyssal demons, Iron dragons, Cyclopes, Temple Spiders, Skeleton (Shayzien Crypts), Zombie (Shayzien Crypts).
Rune full helm • Dropped by Brutal black dragons, Drakes, Brutal red dragons, Greater Nechryaels, Brutal blue dragons, Greater demons, Steel dragons, Twisted Banshees, Warped Jellies.
Dragon med helm • Dropped by the Alchemical Hydra, Brutal black dragons, Brutal red dragons, Brutal blue dragons, Sarachnis, monsters with rare drop table.

Black chainbody • Dropped by Gangsters and Gang boss
Black platebody • Dropped by King Sand Crabs and can be obtained via repairing Damaged armour or in reward casket (easy)
Mithril chainbody • Dropped by Lesser demons.
Mithril platebody • Dropped by Mutated Bloodvelds.
Adamant chainbody • Dropped by Mutated Bloodvelds.
Adamant platebody • Dropped by Bronze dragons, Red dragons, medium clue caskets.
Rune chainbody • Dropped by Lizardman shamans, Deviant spectres, Abyssal demons, Black demons, Greater Nechryaels.
Rune platebody • Dropped by Skotizo, Alchemical Hydra, Brimstone chest, Sarachnis, Brutal black dragons, Brutal red dragons, Brutal blue dragons, Hydras, Hard clue caskets, elite clue caskets.
Dragon chainbody • Extremely rare drop by Dust devils, which require level 65 Slayer to kill.

Legs[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Black platelegs • Dropped by Deviant spectre, Repugnant spectre, and in Reward casket (easy) .
Black plateskirt • Dropped by Gangsters and Gang boss.
Mithril platelegs • Requires 66 smithing.
Mithril plateskirt • Requires 66 smithing.
Adamant platelegs • Dropped by Brutal blue dragons, Brutal red dragons, Greater demons, medium clue caskets.
Rune plateskirt • Dropped by Skotizo, Alchemical Hydra, hard clue caskets, elite clue caskets.
Rune platelegs • Dropped by Skotizo, Brutal black dragons, Brimstone chest, Alchemical Hydra, hard clue caskets, elite clue caskets.
Dragon plateskirt • Dropped by Brutal black dragons, Steel dragons, Iron dragons, Bronze dragons.
Dragon platelegs • Dropped by Brutal black dragons, Steel dragons, Iron dragons, Bronze dragons.
Fremennik kilt • Gives a +1 Strength bonus.
• Only obtainable as a very rare reward from elite clue caskets.

Shields[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Black sq shield • Dropped by Moss giants
Black kiteshield • Dropped by Ice giants
Mithril sq shield • Dropped by Fire giants, Lesser demons, Mountain Trolls
Mithril kiteshield • Dropped by Abyssal demons, Black demons, Bronze dragons, Greater demons, Red dragons.
Adamant sq shield • Dropped by Wyrms, Iron dragons.
Adamant kiteshield • Dropped by Greater Nechryaels, Twisted Banshees, Greater demons.
Rune sq shield • Dropped by Greater Nechryaels, Magpie implings.
Rune kiteshield • Dropped by Hydras, Warped Jellies, Kourend head guards, hard clue caskets, elite clue caskets.
Anti-dragon shield • Sold in Briget's Armour store.
Draconic visage • Can be combined with the anti-dragon shield to create the dragonfire shield, which gives best-in-slot Defence and Strength bonuses.
• Dropped by Brutal black dragons, Brutal red dragons, Brutal blue dragons, Iron dragons, Steel dragons.

Boots[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Boots of stone • Bought from Konar quo Maten
• Requires level 44 Slayer.
Shayzien boots (5) • Dropped by Soldier (tier 5), which can be fought for in the Combat Ring with 100% Shayzien favour.
Black boots • Dropped by Mutated Bloodvelds, which require level 50 Slayer to kill.
Mithril boots • Dropped by Warped Jellies and Vitreous Warped Jellies, which require level 52 Slayer to kill.
Rune boots • Give a +2 Strength bonus, as well as the highest Defence bonuses.
• Dropped by Greater Nechryaels, which require level 80 Slayer to kill.
Spiked manacles • Give a +4 Strength bonus.
• Only obtainable through medium clue caskets.

Gloves[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Slayer gloves • Bought from Konar quo Maten
• Requires level 42 Slayer.
Shayzien gloves (5) • Gives a +3 Strength bonus.
• Dropped by Soldier (tier 5), which can be fought in the Combat Ring with 100% Shayzien favour.
Combat bracelet • Gives a +6 Strength bonus.
• Dragonstone bracelets can be crafted with level 74 Crafting, or obtained from elite clue caskets. Dragonstones can be obtained from Dragon implings, Skotizo, Brutal black dragons, and the rare drop table
Regen bracelet • Gives a +7 Strength bonus.
• Onyx bracelets can be crafted with level 84 Crafting. Onyxes can be obtained as a drop from Tekton and Skotizo.
Ferocious gloves • Gives a +14 Strength bonus.
• Dropped by the Alchemical Hydra, which requires level 95 Slayer to kill.

Neckwear[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Amulet of strength • Gives a +10 Strength bonus, the highest Strength bonus available.
• Ruby amulets can be crafted at level 50 Crafting, or obtained as a drop from Mutated Bloodvelds with level 50 Slayer. A complete amulet of strength is also dropped by Undead Druids.
Amulet of power • Gives a +6 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Diamond amulets can be crafted at level 70 Crafting, or obtained from hunting Magpie implings at 65 Hunter as well as the complete amulet.
• Amulets of power can alternatively be obtained through medium clue caskets.
Amulet of glory • Gives a +6 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Amulets of glory can be obtained from Dragon implings or as their trimmed variant from hard clue caskets. Dragonstone amulets can also be obtained from Dragon implings, or crafted with level 80 Crafting. Dragonstones can be obtained from Dragon implings, Skotizo, Brutal black dragons, and the Rare drop table
Amulet of fury • Gives a +8 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Onyx amulets can be crafted with level 90 Crafting. Onyxes can be obtained as a drop from Tekton and Skotizo.

Ranged Equipment[edit | edit source]

Weaponry[edit | edit source]

Early on, the easiest way to get a Ranged weapon is to fletch one. Fletching a yew shortbow only requires level 65 Fletching, and can fire arrows up to rune arrows. Making a crossbow from scratch is a bit harder, requiring some Smithing levels to make the limbs as well.

Item Notes
Yew shortbow • Fires arrows up to rune arrows, but can not fire broad arrows.
• Can be fletched with level 65 Fletching.
Magic shortbow • Fires arrows up to rune arrows, including broad arrows.
• Can be fletched with level 80 Fletching.
Rune crossbow • Fires bolts up to runite bolts, including broad bolts.
• Runite limbs can be smithed at level 91 Smithing, or obtained as a drop from Iron dragons or Steel dragons. Making the rune crossbow itself requires level 69 Fletching.
• Runite crossbow (u)s can also be farmed from Ancient wizards by hopping worlds before killing all 3 wizards.
• The rune crossbow is also available as a standard loot from elite clue caskets.
Dragon thrownaxe • Has a powerful special attack which can be used to quickly output damage in a short span of time.
• Obtained as a rare drop from Wyrms, Drakes, Hydras, and the Alchemical Hydra.
Dragon knife • Has lower damage than other top-tier Ranged weapons, but attacks at the fastest rate.
• Obtained as a rare drop from Wyrms, Drakes, Hydras, and the Alchemical Hydra.
Chinchompa • Has the unique ability to hit multiple nearby enemies at once. Especially useful in multi-combat areas, such as in the Catacombs of Kourend or the south coast of Hosidius near the Sand Crabs.
• Obtained by trapping them in the Kourend Woodland, requiring level 53 Hunter.
3rd age bow
  • Fires arrows up to Dragon arrow
Dragon hunter crossbow • Strongest available crossbow, with unique bonuses against dragons and other draconic creatures.
• Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.
Twisted bow • Uniquely powerful against monsters with a high Magic level, such as the Great Olm. Fires all types of arrows, including dragon arrows.
• Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Ammunition[edit | edit source]

Ammunition can be a bit challenging to come by within the League, as there are no shops that sell arrows or bolts within Great Kourend and the Kebos Lowlands. Because of this, most ammunition will be crafted by the player, through a combination of Smithing and Fletching. While doing early Smithing training, it can be useful to make various arrowtips or unfinished bolts, for use as ammunition. Once the player has reached level 55 Slayer, they can switch to broad arrows and broad bolts, which can be bought in unfinished form from Konar quo Maten's Slayer Equipment shop.

Item Notes
Broad arrows • Provide Ranged strength bonus between mithril arrows and adamant arrows, but are significantly easier to obtain than either. Require level 55 Slayer to use.
• Broad arrowheads can be bought in packs of 100 from Konar quo Maten, and can be attached to headless arrows at level 52 Fletching.
Rune arrow • Strongest possible arrows usable by the yew shortbow and magic shortbow.
• Can be made by hand with level 75 Fletching (rune arrowtips require level 90 Smithing to make, or can be obtained as a drop from Wyrms.) Rune arrows also drop from Brutal black dragons, Brutal red dragons, Brutal blue dragons, Drakes, Dust devils, Fire giants, Ninja implings, Red dragons, and the Chambers of Xeric.
Dragon arrow • Strongest arrows available, only usable by the twisted bow and the 3rd age bow.
• Dragon arrows drop directly from Dragon implings and the Chambers of Xeric. They can also be made with level 90 Fletching with dragon arrowtips, which can be obtained by opening brimstone chests, or as drops from Brutal black dragons, Brutal red dragons, Brutal blue dragons, Dragon implings.
Broad bolts • Have strength equal to adamant bolts, but are significantly easier to obtain. Require level 55 Slayer to use.
• Unfinished broad bolts can be bought in packs of 100 from Konar quo Maten, and can be finished with feathers at level 55 Fletching.
Ruby bolts (e) • Their Blood Forfeit special effect deals damage equal to 20% of the opponent's current Hitpoints, so it is extremely powerful against monsters with high Hitpoints.
• Can be crafted by hand, requiring level 73 Smithing, level 63 Fletching, and level 49 Magic.
Diamond bolts (e) • Their Armour Piercing special effect deals extra damage and ignores enemy defences, making it very useful against monsters with high defence.
• Can be crafted by hand, requiring level 73 Smithing, level 65 Fletching, and level 57 Magic.

Armour[edit | edit source]

Head[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Leather cowl • Gives +1 Ranged bonus.
• Crafted from leather at level 9 Crafting. Note that access to a tanner is more difficult than usual, as it requires either five dragonstones or defeating the Shaeded Beast.
Coif • Gives +2 Ranged bonus.
• Crafted from leather at level 38 Crafting, or obtained from easy clue caskets.
Blessed coif • Each gives +7 Ranged bonus, along with minor defensive bonuses and a +1 Prayer bonus.

Robin hood hat • Gives +8 Ranged bonus.
• Only obtainable as a rare reward from hard clue caskets.
3rd age range coif • Gives +9 Ranged bonus.
• Only obtainable as an extremely rare reward from Treasure Trails.
Armadyl helmet • Gives the best-in-slot +10 Ranged bonus.
• Only obtainable as a 1/1,000,000 drop from Armadylean guards, encountered while completing an elite clue scroll.

Hardleather body • Gives +8 Ranged bonus.

Magic Equipment[edit | edit source]

Weaponry[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Elemental staves • Can be bought from Filamina's Wares, with at least 20% Arceuus favour.
Lava battlestaff • Obtained as a 1/128 drop from Deviant spectres, which require level 60 Slayer to kill.
Mist battlestaff • Obtained as a rare drop from superior slayer monsters.
Dust battlestaff • Obtained as a rare drop from Dust devils or superior slayer monsters.
Slayer's staff • Is required to cast the Magic Dart spell, which it can autocast.
• Can be purchased from Konar quo Maten. Requires level 50 Magic and level 55 Slayer to use.
Kodai wand • Gives unlimited water runes when wielded, as well as a 15% chance to negate all rune costs.
• Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Runes[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Air rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Mind rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Water rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Earth rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Fire rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Body rune • Can be bought at Regath's Wares and Thyria's Wares.
Cosmic rune • Dropped by Skeletons, Zombies, Twisted Banshees, Big frogs, Cyclopes, Gang bosses, Gangsters, Hill Giants, Moss giants, Sarachnis, Temple Spiders, Undead Druids, Hobgoblins, and Ice giants.
Chaos rune • Can be bought individually or in packs of 100 at Thyria's Wares.
Nature rune • Dropped by Essence implings, Drakes, Big frogs, Mountain trolls, Dwarves, Ice giants, Sulphur Lizards, Moss giants, Cyclopes, Hill Giants, Hobgoblins, Temple Spiders, Undead Druids, Kourend guards, Kourend head guards, Zombies, Skeletons, and Town Guards.
Law rune • Dropped by Essence implings, Drakes, Hydras, Ankous, Brutal dragons, Bronze dragons, Moss giants, Cyclopes, Hill Giants, Hobgoblins, Mountain trolls, Ice giants, Abyssal demons, Barbarians, Black demons, and Fire giants as well as the wizards found locked upstairs near the bank in the Kourend Start zone.
Death rune • Can be bought at Thyria's Wares.
Blood rune • Can be crafted at the Blood Altar with level 77 Runecraft and 100% Arceuus favour. Small amounts in stock at Arceuus general store. Dropped by mutated bloodvelds and moss giants.
Soul rune • Can be crafted at the Soul Altar with level 90 Runecraft and 100% Arceuus favour. Can also be purchased at Arceuus general store.
Dust rune • Dropped by Dust devils.
Mud rune • Dropped by Undead Druids and Essence implings.
Smoke rune • Dropped by Essence implings.
Steam rune • Dropped by Essence implings.
Lava rune • Dropped by Essence implings.

Armour[edit | edit source]

Head[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Blue wizard hat • Dropped by Imps. Can also be bought from Regath's Wares.
Wizard hat • Can be bought from Regath's Wares.
Xerician hat • Can be crafted from Xerician fabric, requiring level 14 Crafting. Requires level 10 Defence and level 20 Magic to equip.
Splitbark helm • Dropped by Ninja implings.
Mystic hat (dusk) • Obtained as a rare reward from the brimstone chest.
Enchanted hat • Only obtainable as a rare reward from hard clue caskets.
Mitre • Only obtainable as a rare reward from medium clue caskets.
Ancestral hat • Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Body[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Black robe • Dropped by Dark wizards and Ankous.
Xerician top • Can be crafted from Xerician fabric, requiring level 22 Crafting. Requires level 10 Defence and level 20 Magic to equip.
Mystic robe top (light) • Dropped by the Alchemical Hydra.
Mystic robe top (dusk) • Obtained as a rare reward from the brimstone chest.
Enchanted top • Only obtainable as a rare reward from hard clue caskets.
Ancestral robe top • Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Legs[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Xerician robe • Can be crafted from Xerician fabric, requiring level 17 Crafting. Requires level 10 Defence and level 20 Magic to equip.
Mystic robe bottom • Dropped by the Hydras and Dragon implings.
Mystic robe bottom (light) • Dropped by the Alchemical Hydra.
Mystic robe bottom (dark) • Dropped by Deviant spectres.
Mystic robe bottom (dusk) • Obtained as a rare reward from the brimstone chest.
Enchanted robe • Only obtainable as a rare reward from hard clue caskets.
Ancestral robe bottom • Only obtainable as a rare reward from the Chambers of Xeric.

Shields[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Oak shield • Gives minor defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from oak logs with level 27 Fletching.
Willow shield • Gives minor defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from willow logs with level 42 Fletching.
Maple shield • Gives minor defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from maple logs with level 57 Fletching.
Yew shield • Gives some defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from yew logs with level 72 Fletching.
Magic shield • Gives some defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from magic logs with level 87 Fletching.
Redwood shield • Gives some defensive bonuses, with no penalty to Magic.
• Can be crafted from redwood logs with level 92 Fletching.
Tome of fire • Gives a +8 Magic bonus, even uncharged. As the only shield slot item with a Magic bonus, it is the best option for any form of Magic combat, using fire spells or otherwise.
• Obtained as a rare reward from the Wintertodt, and charged with burnt pages, also from the Wintertodt.

Boots[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Mystic boots • Dropped by Ninja implings and Magpie implings.
Mystic boots (dusk) • Obtained as a rare reward from the brimstone chest.
Boots of brimstone • Created by combining a Drake's claw (a 1/2,560 drop from Drakes, which require level 84 Slayer to kill) with boots of stone.
Wizard boots • Only obtainable as a reward from medium clue caskets.

Gloves[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Splitbark gauntlets • Dropped by Magpie implings.
Mystic gloves • Dropped by Ninja implings and Magpie implings.
Mystic gloves (light) • Dropped by Sulphur Lizards.
Mystic gloves (dark) • Dropped by Twisted Banshees.
Mystic gloves (dusk) • Obtained as a rare reward from the brimstone chest.
Combat bracelet • Gives a +3 Magic bonus, equivalent to mystic gloves, along with other bonuses.
• Dragonstone bracelets can be crafted with level 74 Crafting, or obtained from elite clue caskets. Dragonstones can be obtained from Dragon implings, Skotizo, Brutal black dragons and the Rare drop table
Regen bracelet • Gives a +3 Magic bonus, equivalent to mystic gloves, along with other bonuses.
• Onyx bracelets can be crafted with level 84 Crafting. Onyxes can be obtained as a drop from Tekton and Skotizo.

Neckwear[edit | edit source]

Item Notes
Amulet of magic • Gives a +10 Magic bonus.
• Sapphire amulets can be crafted at level 24 Crafting. Amulets of magic also drop from Undead Druids, or obtained from easy clue caskets.
Amulet of glory • Gives a +10 Magic bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Amulets of glory can be obtained from Dragon implings. Dragonstone amulets can also be obtained from Dragon implings, or crafted with level 80 Crafting. Dragonstones can be obtained from Dragon implings, Skotizo, Brutal black dragons and the Rare drop table

• You can also obtain a trimmed amulet of glory from hard clue caskets.

Amulet of fury • Gives a +10 Magic bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
• Onyx amulets can be crafted with level 90 Crafting. Onyxes can be obtained as a drop from Tekton and Skotizo.
3rd age amulet • Gives a +15 Magic bonus.
• Only obtainable as an obscenely rare reward from Treasure Trails.

{{Twisted League Guide Links}} {{ToC|limit=2}} {{clear|left}} ==General Equipment== While most equipment varies for the different styles of combat, some pieces of equipment are universal, and have no real variety between the different skills. This is usually because of the limitations of the League, where "better" items for specific combat styles are unavailable. ===Rings=== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Ring of recoil}} |{{*}} Returns a small amount of damage done to the player back to the monster attacking them.
{{*}} [[Sapphire ring]]s can be crafted at level 20 Crafting. A ring mould can be found using the [[tool store 4]] in a player owned house, requiring 44 construction. |- |{{plinkt|Brimstone ring}} |{{*}} The only stat-boosting ring available, it gives best-in-slot offensive and defensive bonuses.
{{*}} Pieces of the Brimstone ring are obtained as rare drops from [[hydra]]s or the [[Alchemical Hydra]], which require level 95 [[Slayer]] to kill. |} ===Capes=== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Black cape}} |{{*}} Has very minor defensive bonuses.
{{*}} Dropped by the [[Highwayman]] west of the [[Port Piscarilius]] docks. |- |{{plinkt|Vestment cloak|pic=Ancient cloak}} |{{*}} Along with slightly better defensive bonuses, gives a +1 Magic boost.
{{*}} Only obtainable as a reward from [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Obsidian cape (r)}} |{{*}} Has significant defensive bonuses, equivalent to those of a [[skillcape]].
{{*}} Only obtainable as a reward from [[Reward casket (master)|master clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Cape of skulls}} |{{*}} Has significant defensive bonuses, equivalent to those of a [[skillcape]].
{{*}} Only obtainable as a reward from [[Reward casket (easy)|easy clue caskets]] |- |{{plinkt|Construct. cape(t)}} |{{*}} Has the same significant defensive bonuses of the obsidian cape, with an additional +4 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Obtainable from the [[Estate Agent]] after reaching level 99 [[Construction]], with at least one other skill also at level 99. |- |{{plinkt|3rd age cloak}} |{{*}} Has the same significant defensive bonuses of the obsidian cape, with an additional +5 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Only obtainable as an extremely rare reward from [[Treasure Trails]]. |} ===Prayer Equipment=== Some gear is notable for its Prayer bonus, rather than any offensive or defensive stats it may give. {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Holy sandals}} |{{*}} Gives a +3 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Only obtainable as a rare reward from medium clue caskets. |- |{{plinkt|Holy wraps}} |{{*}} Gives a +3 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Only obtainable as a very rare reward from elite clue caskets. |- |{{plinkt|Kharedst's memoirs}} |{{*}} Besides being useful for its teleports, also gives a +1 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Obtained as a reward from completing the [[Client of Kourend]] [[quest]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rada's blessing 2}} |{{*}} As of the 2nd blessing it will give a +1 Prayer bonus. The 4th blessing will provide +2 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Obtained as a reward from completing the Kourend & Kebos diary. |- |{{plinkt|Shade robe top}} |{{*}} Gives a +5 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Dropped by [[shade]]s at a 1/4 rate. |- |{{plinkt|Shade robe}} |{{*}} Gives a +4 Prayer bonus.
{{*}} Dropped by [[shade]]s at a 1/4 rate. |- |{{plinkt|Vestment robes|pic=Ancient robe top}} |{{*}} Pieces of the vestment robes sets give the highest available Prayer bonuses for their respective item slots.
{{*}} Only obtainable as rewards from completing [[Reward casket (easy)|easy]], [[Reward casket (medium)|medium]], and [[Reward casket (hard)|hard]] clue caskets. |} ==Melee Equipment== ===Weaponry=== At low levels, the easiest source of weaponry will be [[Briget's Weapons]], a shop available with at least 20% [[Shayzien]] favour. She sells [[scimitar]]s up to the [[mithril scimitar]], and [[sword]]s up to the [[adamant sword]], which is the best weapon she offers. Beyond her offerings, any better weaponry must be obtained either through [[Smithing]] or from a monster drop. A list of recommended weapons and how to obtain them is as follows: {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Rune scimitar}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Gangster]]s, [[Gang boss]]es, [[Fire giant]]s, [[Zombie (Shayzien Crypts)|Zombies]], [[Skeleton (Shayzien Crypts)|Skeletons]], [[Kourend head guard]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Mystic air staff}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Dust devil]]s at a 1/128 rate. Dust devils require 65 Slayer to kill. Despite being a magic staff it has decent crush melee stats, useful for killing Sarachnis. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon hasta}} |{{*}} Obtained from the [[brimstone chest]] at a 1/200 rate. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon sword}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Wyrm]]s at a 1/10,000 rate, increased to 1/2,000 rate while on a [[Slayer task]]. Wyrms require level 62 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon warhammer}} |{{*}} Extemely useful for its unique Defence-lowering [[Special attack]].
{{*}} Dropped by [[Lizardman shaman]]s at a 1/5000 rate. |- |{{plinkt|Sarachnis cudgel}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Sarachnis]] at a 1/384 rate. |- |{{plinkt|Abyssal dagger}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Abyssal demon]]s at a 1/32,768 rate, which require level 85 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Abyssal whip}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Abyssal demon]]s at a 1/512 rate, which require level 85 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon hunter lance}} |{{*}} Uniquely powerful against [[dragons]] and other [[draconic creatures]].
{{*}} Dropped by the [[Alchemical Hydra]] at a 1/1,001 rate, which requires level 95 Slayer and a Hydra slayer task to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Elder maul}} |{{*}} Only obtainable as a rare reward from the [[Chambers of Xeric]]. |} ===Armour=== Within the limitations of the Twisted League, most of the usual strength-boosting armours are unavailable. This means that in most cases, metal armour sets will be the best equipment for Melee combat. With at least 20% [[Shayzien]] favour, low-level armours can be sourced from [[Briget's Armour]]. No shops sell any armours better than Steel, so any stronger equipment must be obtained either through [[Smithing]] or from a monster drop. A list of armour pieces and monsters that drop them is as follows: ====Head==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Black med helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Gangster]]s, [[Gang boss]], [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s, and [[Insatiable mutated Bloodveld]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Black full helm}} |{{*}} Obtained in [[Reward casket (easy)]]. |- |{{plinkt|Mithril full helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s, [[Brutal blue dragon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant med helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Temple Spider]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant full helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rune med helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s, [[Lizardman shaman]]s, [[Wyrm]]s, [[Greater Nechryael]]s, [[Sarachnis]], [[Twisted Banshee]]s, [[Abyssal demon]]s, [[Lesser demon]]s, [[Black demon]]s, [[Abyssal demon]]s, [[Iron dragon]]s, [[Cyclops|Cyclopes]], [[Temple Spider]]s, [[Skeleton (Shayzien Crypts)]], [[Zombie (Shayzien Crypts)]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rune full helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Drake]]s, [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Greater Nechryael]]s, [[Brutal blue dragon]]s, [[Greater demon]]s, [[Steel dragon]]s, [[Twisted Banshee]]s, [[Warped Jelly|Warped Jellies]]. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon med helm}} |{{*}} Dropped by the [[Alchemical Hydra]], [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Brutal blue dragon]]s, [[Sarachnis]], monsters with [[rare drop table]]. |} ====Body==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Black chainbody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Gangster]]s and [[Gang boss]] |- |{{plinkt|Black platebody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[King Sand Crab]]s and can be obtained via repairing [[Damaged armour]] or in [[reward casket (easy)]] |- |{{plinkt|Mithril chainbody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Lesser demon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Mithril platebody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant chainbody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant platebody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Bronze dragon]]s, [[Red dragon]]s, [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rune chainbody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Lizardman shaman]]s, [[Deviant spectre]]s, [[Abyssal demon]]s, [[Black demon]]s, [[Greater Nechryael]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Rune platebody}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Skotizo]], [[Alchemical Hydra]], [[Brimstone chest]], [[Sarachnis]], [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Brutal blue dragon]]s, [[Hydra]]s, [[Reward casket (hard)|Hard clue caskets]], [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon chainbody}} |{{*}} Extremely rare drop by [[Dust devil]]s, which require level 65 Slayer to kill. |} ====Legs==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Black platelegs}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Deviant spectre]], [[Repugnant spectre]], and in [[Reward casket (easy)]] . |- |{{plinkt|Black plateskirt}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Gangster]]s and [[Gang boss]]. |- |{{plinkt|Mithril platelegs}} |{{*}} Requires 66 [[smithing]]. |- |{{plinkt|Mithril plateskirt}} |{{*}} Requires 66 [[smithing]]. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant platelegs}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal blue dragon]]s, [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Greater demon]]s, [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rune plateskirt}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Skotizo]], [[Alchemical Hydra]], [[Reward casket (hard)|hard clue caskets]], [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Rune platelegs}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Skotizo]], [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Brimstone chest]], [[Alchemical Hydra]], [[Reward casket (hard)|hard clue caskets]], [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon plateskirt}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Steel dragon]]s, [[Iron dragon]]s, [[Bronze dragon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon platelegs}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Steel dragon]]s, [[Iron dragon]]s, [[Bronze dragon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Fremennik kilt}} |{{*}} Gives a +1 Strength bonus.
{{*}} Only obtainable as a very rare reward from [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |} ====Shields==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Black sq shield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Moss giant]]s |- |{{plinkt|Black kiteshield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Ice giant]]s |- |{{plinkt|Mithril sq shield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Fire giant]]s, [[Lesser demon]]s, Mountain Trolls |- |{{plinkt|Mithril kiteshield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Abyssal demon]]s, [[Black demon]]s, [[Bronze dragon]]s, [[Greater demon]]s, [[Red dragon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant sq shield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Wyrm]]s, [[Iron dragon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Adamant kiteshield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Greater Nechryael]]s, [[Twisted Banshee]]s, [[Greater demon]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Rune sq shield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Greater Nechryael]]s, [[Magpie impling]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Rune kiteshield}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Hydra]]s, [[Warped Jelly|Warped Jellies]], [[Kourend head guard]]s, [[Reward casket (hard)|hard clue caskets]], [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Anti-dragon shield}} |{{*}} Sold in [[Briget's Armour]] store. |- |{{plinkt|Draconic visage}} |{{*}} Can be combined with the [[anti-dragon shield]] to create the [[dragonfire shield]], which gives best-in-slot Defence and Strength bonuses.
{{*}} Dropped by [[Brutal black dragon]]s, [[Brutal red dragon]]s, [[Brutal blue dragon]]s, [[Iron dragon]]s, [[Steel dragon]]s. |} ====Boots==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Boots of stone}} |{{*}} Bought from [[Konar quo Maten]]
{{*}} Requires level 44 [[Slayer]]. |- |{{plinkt|Shayzien boots (5)}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Soldier (tier 5)]], which can be fought for in the [[Combat Ring (Shayzien)|Combat Ring]] with 100% Shayzien favour. |- |{{plinkt|Black boots}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s, which require level 50 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Mithril boots}} |{{*}} Dropped by [[Warped Jelly|Warped Jellies]] and [[Vitreous warped Jelly|Vitreous Warped Jellies]], which require level 52 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Rune boots}} |{{*}} Give a +2 Strength bonus, as well as the highest Defence bonuses.
{{*}} Dropped by [[Greater Nechryael]]s, which require level 80 Slayer to kill. |- |{{plinkt|Spiked manacles}} |{{*}} Give a +4 Strength bonus.
{{*}} Only obtainable through [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |} ====Gloves==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Slayer gloves}} |{{*}} Bought from [[Konar quo Maten]]
{{*}} Requires level 42 [[Slayer]]. |- |{{plinkt|Shayzien gloves (5)}} |{{*}} Gives a +3 Strength bonus.
{{*}} Dropped by [[Soldier (tier 5)]], which can be fought in the [[Combat Ring (Shayzien)|Combat Ring]] with 100% Shayzien favour. |- |{{plinkt|Combat bracelet}} |{{*}} Gives a +6 Strength bonus.
{{*}} [[Dragonstone bracelet]]s can be crafted with level 74 Crafting, or obtained from [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. [[Dragonstone]]s can be obtained from [[Dragon impling]]s, [[Skotizo]], [[Brutal black dragon]]s, and the [[rare drop table]] |- |{{plinkt|Regen bracelet}} |{{*}} Gives a +7 Strength bonus.
{{*}} [[Onyx bracelet]]s can be crafted with level 84 Crafting. [[Onyx]]es can be obtained as a drop from [[Tekton]] and [[Skotizo]]. |- |{{plinkt|Ferocious gloves}} |{{*}} Gives a +14 Strength bonus.
{{*}} Dropped by the [[Alchemical Hydra]], which requires level 95 Slayer to kill. |} ====Neckwear==== {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Amulet of strength}} |{{*}} Gives a +10 Strength bonus, the highest Strength bonus available.
{{*}} [[Ruby amulet]]s can be crafted at level 50 Crafting, or obtained as a drop from [[Mutated Bloodveld]]s with level 50 Slayer. A complete amulet of strength is also dropped by [[Undead Druid]]s. |- |{{plinkt|Amulet of power}} |{{*}} Gives a +6 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
{{*}} [[Diamond amulet]]s can be crafted at level 70 Crafting, or obtained from hunting [[Magpie impling]]s at 65 Hunter as well as the complete amulet.
{{*}} Amulets of power can alternatively be obtained through [[Reward casket (medium)|medium clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Amulet of glory}} |{{*}} Gives a +6 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
{{*}} Amulets of glory can be obtained from [[Dragon impling]]s or as their trimmed variant from [[Reward casket (hard)|hard clue caskets]]. [[Dragonstone amulet]]s can also be obtained from Dragon implings, or crafted with level 80 Crafting. [[Dragonstone]]s can be obtained from [[Dragon impling]]s, [[Skotizo]], [[Brutal black dragon]]s, and the [[Rare drop table]] |- |{{plinkt|Amulet of fury}} |{{*}} Gives a +8 Strength bonus, along with other offensive and defensive bonuses.
{{*}} [[Onyx amulet]]s can be crafted with level 90 Crafting. [[Onyx]]es can be obtained as a drop from [[Tekton]] and [[Skotizo]]. |} ==Ranged Equipment== ===Weaponry=== Early on, the easiest way to get a Ranged weapon is to [[Fletching|fletch]] one. Fletching a [[yew shortbow]] only requires level 65 Fletching, and can fire arrows up to [[rune arrows]]. Making a crossbow from scratch is a bit harder, requiring some [[Smithing]] levels to make the limbs as well. {|class="wikitable align-center-1" !colspan="2" |Item !Notes |- |{{plinkt|Yew shortbow}} |{{*}} Fires arrows up to [[rune arrow]]s, but can not fire [[broad arrow]]s.
{{*}} Can be fletched with level 65 Fletching. |- |{{plinkt|Magic shortbow}} |{{*}} Fires arrows up to [[rune arrow]]s, including [[broad arrows]].
{{*}} Can be fletched with level 80 Fletching. |- |{{plinkt|Rune crossbow}} |{{*}} Fires bolts up to [[runite bolts]], including [[broad bolts]].
{{*}} [[Runite limbs]] can be smithed at level 91 Smithing, or obtained as a drop from [[Iron dragon]]s or [[Steel dragon]]s. Making the rune crossbow itself requires level 69 Fletching.
{{*}} [[Runite crossbow (u)]]s can also be farmed from [[Ancient wizard]]s by hopping worlds before killing all 3 wizards.
{{*}} The [[rune crossbow]] is also available as a standard loot from [[Reward casket (elite)|elite clue caskets]]. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon thrownaxe}} |{{*}} Has a powerful [[special attack]] which can be used to quickly output damage in a short span of time.
{{*}} Obtained as a rare drop from [[Wyrm]]s, [[Drake]]s, [[Hydra]]s, and the [[Alchemical Hydra]]. |- |{{plinkt|Dragon knife}} |{{*}} Has lower damage than other top-tier Ranged weapons, but attacks at the fastest rate.
{{*}} Obtained as a rare drop from [[Wyrm]]s, [[Drake]]s, [[Hydra]]s, and the [[Alchemical Hydra]]. |- |{{plinkt|Chinchompa}} |{{*}} Has the unique ability to hit multiple nearby enemies at once. Especially useful in multi-combat areas, such as in the [[Catacombs of Kourend]] or the south coast of [[Hosidius]] near the [[Sand Crab]]s.
{{*}} Obtained by trapping them in the [[Kourend Woodland]], requiring level 53 Hunter. |- | |[[3rd age bow]] | * Fires arrows up to [[Dragon arrows|Dragon arrow]] |- |{{plinkt|Dragon hunter crossbow}} |{{*}} Strongest available crossbow, with unique bonuses against [[dragons]] and other [[draconic creatures]].
{{*}} Only obtainable as a rare reward from the [[Chambers of Xeric]]. |- |{{plinkt|Twisted bow}} |{{*}} Uniquely powerful against monsters with a high [[Magic]] level, such as the [[Great Olm]]. Fires all types of arrows, including [[dragon arrow]]s.
{{*}} Only obtainable as a rare reward from the [[Chambers of Xeric]]. |} ===Ammunition=== Ammunition can be a bit challenging to come by within the League, as there are no shops that sell [[arrows]] or [[bolts]] within [[Great Kourend]] and the [[Kebos Lowlands]]. Because of this, most ammunition will be crafted by the player, through a combination of [[Smithing]] and [[Fletching]]. While doing early Smithing training, it can be useful to make various arrowtips or unfinished bolts, for use as ammunition.
